summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Appointment (Today) screen overhaul. All 15 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI testing verified all required features including 16-column table, filters, Rescheduled/Cancelled section, two-line status format, Remarks tooltips, Priority badges, Docket readiness badges, and Lost Customer column.
passed_tests: Login with admin/admin credentials - works correctly
GET /api/appointments?view=day returns 14 appointments with all required fields

Main table shows 16 columns: Time, Source, Customer Name, PH. No, Mail ID, Veh Reg No, Model, Current KM, OTS No, Type of Service, Allocated SA Name, Docket Readiness, Status, CRE Name, Lost Customer, Remarks
Main table shows 10 regular appointments (rescheduled_in_n1=false and cancelled_in_n1=false)
Rescheduled / Cancelled in N-1 section appears below with 4 appointments
Status column displays two-line format: N-1: [status] and TD: [status]
Remarks column shows 'Yes' with tooltip on hover for entries with specific_repair data
Remarks column shows 'No' for entries without specific_repair
Branch filter works - selecting 'Main Branch' reduces results from 14 to 8
Source filter works - selecting 'SDR' filters by SDR source
SA filter works - selecting 'Arjun' filters results (5 appointments + 2 rescheduled/cancelled)
CRE filter works - selecting 'CRE Alex' filters results (5 appointments + 2 rescheduled/cancelled)
Horizontal scrolling works on the table to reveal all 16 columns
Priority customer indicator (P badge) shows next to priority customer names
Docket readiness shows Yes/No with green/red badges
Lost Customer column shows Yes (red)/No with appropriate colors
seed_data_creation: 14 appointments seeded with all required fields (branch, assigned_cre_user, appointment_day_outcome, rescheduled_in_n1, cancelled_in_n1). 10 regular appointments and 4 rescheduled/cancelled appointments.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Appointment page fully functional. All filters work (Branch, Status, Outcome, Source, SA, CRE). Data structure includes rescheduled_in_n1/cancelled_in_n1 flags for separating into sections. Tooltip on Remarks column works with specific_repair data.
